manipulated_prompt_obj.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow on the table, the book on the table and the plate on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a pillow, a wardrobe and a bed. The pillow is on the bed. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a living room here.

You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow on the table, the book on the table and the plate on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a pillow, a wardrobe and a bed. The pillow is on the bed. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a living room here.
> take pillow
You take the pillow. In your inventory you have a pillow.

> take pillow
You take the pillow. In your inventory you have a pillow.
> go to living room
You are in a living room now. There are a side table, a table, a shelf, a book, a couch and a chair. The book is on the side table. There are passages to a kitchen and a bedroom here.

message.content:
> take plate 
> go to living room 
is not possible as I can only type one action. So 
> go to living room

clem_player.response:
> take plate 
> go to living room 
is not possible as I can only type one action. So 
> go to living room
